item.title: Consistent Hashing and Random Trees: Distributed Caching Protocols for Relieving Hot Spots on the World Wide Web
item.description: Consistent hashing is used for load balancing in cache systems at the scale of a Content Delivery Network (CDN), as discussed. The paper Consistent Hashing and Random Trees: Distributed Caching Protocols for Relieving Hot Spots on the World Wide Web proposed the hashing algorithm to decrease or eliminate the occurrence of hot spots in the network.
